item.description:
Carl Jung used tarot cards to study archetypes, synchronicity, and the collective unconscious. He even used them with his patients in psychoanalysis. Cards can be useful tools in dream interpretation, stimulating the imagination, exploring the unconscious, as well as inducing dream states and dream recall. Cards can also be used for guidance, foretelling the future, answering your questions, and understanding the meaning of your life.

In this Meetup, Deerheart will share how he uses cards in his own dreamwork, initiating dream states, as well as interpreting his dreams and waking visions. He will also lead the group in a game using dream cards. Various dream cards, oracle cards, animal cards, and fortune telling cards will be used as examples. If you have have a set of cards, you are encouraged to bring them. Come and learn what's in the cards for you!

This meeting will be facilitated by Deerheart. Deerheart is a spiritual guide, visionary artist, and tantric shaman. People are drawn to him to share their life stories, life challenges, and dreams. He provides gentle guidance, understanding, and intuitive healing love energy. His heart of compassion looks upon all with unconditional love. An experienced explorer of the dream realms for for over 25 years, he has researched and studied many books and studied under many teachers. For more information about him, visit his website, Visionary Dream Guide.

Payment is $10 and can be made online or in person. Anyone who cannot afford to pay is encouraged to attend anyway and should contact the group organizer Deerheart before attending.

Event will be from 7 pm until 9 pm. Space is limited to 15 people. RSVP requested. Please update your RSVP if you are unable to attend, to allow others to attend. Thank you.

For directions and other information about location please visit the Cambridge Swedenborg Chapel website.
item.how_to_find_us: Side entrance by the parking lot, up stairs, through hallway, left into parlor.
item.name: It's in the Cards: Cards as Dream Tools
